foxml:datastreamVersion.LABEL: Dublin Core Record for this object

template.name: LTERN Collection Template
template.briefDesc: For recording metadata about Datasets, Catalogues, Indexes, Collections, Registries, and Repositories

tab.label: Coverage
tab.name: coverage
tab.tooltip: Dates and Locations relating to collection

item.label: Title
item.name: name
item.tooltip:
This is the title of the data collection. It needs to be unique, i.e. do not use a title that is identical to an existing publication that is related to and/or underpinned by the data.
Titles that are descriptive of the actual data are best. Try to include key distinctive characteristics that would provide information for potential users to determine if the data might be useful to them. These may include information specific to the entities studied, survey data, observations, images collected, location, time, and temporal or spatial coverage.
Examples: Net levels of greenhouse gas emission and sources in the New South Wales Hunter Valley, 1990 - 1998.

item.label: Brief Title
item.name: abbrName
item.tooltip: Please include a brief title if your title is very long

item.label: Alternate Title
item.name: altName
item.tooltip: If there is an alternative title for your data collection, please include it here.

item.label: Collection Type
item.name: subType
item.tooltip: Catalogue or Index - a collection of descriptions describing the content of one or more collective works at the item level. Collection - compiled content created as separate and independent works and assembled into a collective whole Registry - a collection of registry objects compiled to support the business of a given community Repository - a collection of physical or digital objects compiled for information and documentation purposes and/or for storage and safekeeping Dataset - a collection of physical or digital objects generated by research activities. Classification Scheme - A list or arrangement of terms used in a particular context e.g. ontologies, thesauri Software - One or more items that represent a software product

item.label: Access Privileges
item.name: ownerGroup
item.tooltip: Please choose the access privilege group for the collection

item.label: DOI - Digital Object Identifier
item.name: doi
item.tooltip:
The Digital Object Identifier for this record.
Please note that if this does not already exist a DOI will be created when the record is published

item.label: Website Address
item.name: websiteAddress
item.tooltip: Websites at which the collections data is held

item.label: Metadata Language
item.name: metaLang
item.tooltip: Please select the language that you are using to describe this data

item.label: Data Language
item.name: dataLang
item.tooltip: Please select the language the data is in

item.label: Significance Statement
item.name: significanceStatement
item.tooltip:
What is significant about this dataset. For example:
The first Australian full talking film.

item.label: Brief Description
item.name: briefDesc
item.tooltip: A brief summary about the data

item.label: Full Description
item.name: fullDesc
item.tooltip: The description should be as rich as possible. If applicable, include: the scope; details of what is being studied or recorded; methodologies used, information about any instruments that were used to produce and/or collect the data; relevant standards used; conditions under which the study or research occured or the data was collected, etc If there were any problems or other issues with methods used to produce and/or collect the data, please include those as well.

item.label: Principal Investigator
item.name: principalInvestigator
item.tooltip: Please record the name of the principal investigator

item.label: Supervisors
item.name: supervisor
item.tooltip: Please record the name of the person identified as supervisor in relation to the creation of the data. (Note that this may be the same as the Primary Contact.)

item.label: Collaborators
item.name: collaborator
item.tooltip: Please record the names of any other collaborators in the research project which created the data.

item.label: Fields of Research
item.name: anzforSubject
item.tooltip:
Include Fields of Research terms and corresponding classification codes to be associated with the resource being described. The Fields of Research Classfication can be found at the following URL.
http://www.arc.gov.au/applicants/codes.htm#FOR

item.label: Socio-Economic Objective
item.name: anzseoSubject
item.tooltip:
Include terms and corresponding classification codes to be associated with the resource being described. Information on the Socio-Economic Objectives Classication Codes can be found at the following URL.
http://www.arc.gov.au/applicants/codes.htm#SEO

item.label: Keywords
item.name: locSubject
item.tooltip:
Record keywords describing the activity. 5-10 keywords will normally be sufficient. The keywords must be specific enough for researchers with similar interests to find your activity.
If you need assistance in selecting keywords, there are many thesauri that may be helpful. Please use one appropriate to your discipline. If you are unable to identify a discipline specific classification scheme, you may wish to use the Library of Congress Classification scheme available at http://www.loc.gov/catdir/cpso/lcco/

item.label: Type of Research Activity
item.name: anztoaSubject
item.tooltip: If appropriate, assign a research activity classification. There are four set values that can be assigned. Please choose one.

item.label: Date Coverage
item.name: coverageDates
item.tooltip: If appropriate, please indicate a date range relevant to the content of the material described. 1990 - 2005 2011-05-29 - 2011-12-31 2012-06-21T11:49:53+10:00 - 2012-07-02T15:21+10:00

item.label: Time Period
item.name: coverageDateText
item.tooltip: If appropriate, please describe the time period during which the data was collected, observations were made, images were created or the time period that the resource is linked to intellectually or thematically. Examples include: 18th Century World War II

item.label: Geospatial Location
item.name: coverageArea
item.tooltip: If appropriate, please include geospatial location information relevant to the research dataset/collection. This information may describe a geographical area where the data was collected, a place which is the subject of the collection or a location which is the focus of an activity e.g. co-ordinates or place name.

option.label: KML long/lat co-ordinates from GML defining a polygon
DCMI Box notation conformant with iso 19139
Keyhole Markup Language co-ordinates defining a polygon
Spatial Location Information in DCMI Point Notation

item.label: Date of data creation
item.name: createdDate
item.tooltip:
The date/year the data was created. It may be the date the information was created before an embargo period. For example:
1987 2005-06 2009-01-24

item.label: Year of data publication
item.name: citationYear
item.tooltip: The year the data was first published for citation purposes. If this field is not populated when publishing it will default to the year it is published in ANU Data Commons

item.label: Creator(s) for Citation
item.name: citCreator
item.tooltip:
The creator(s) of the data for citation purposes. This field indicates who should be considered named in a citation. Defaults to 'The Australian National University'. For example:
T Irino; R Tada Geofon operator Michael Denhard

item.label: Publisher for Citation
item.name: citationPublisher
item.tooltip:
The publisher of the data. Defaults to 'The Australian National University Data Commons'. For example:
Australian Data Archive Incorporated Research Institutions for Seismology

item.label: Publications
item.name: publication
item.tooltip: If appropriate, please include information about any publications that relate to the collection/dataset For example: Identifier Type: International Standard Serial Number Identifier Value: 0278-7393 Publication Reference: Heathcote, A. (2003) Item recognition memory and the ROC. Journal of Experimental Psychology: Learning, Memory and Cognition, 29, 1210-1230.

option.label: identifier unique within a local context

item.label: Related Websites
item.name: relatedWebsites
item.tooltip:
If appropriate, please include a URL and Notes for any websites that relate to the resource being described. For example:
URL: http://anusf.anu.edu.au/index.php
Title: ANU Supercomputing Facility

item.label: Other Related Identifiers
item.name: externalId
item.tooltip: Identifiers for systems external to ANU Data Commons

item.label: Access Rights
item.name: accessRights
item.tooltip:
Enter a statement about access (or access conditions) to the resource. This will include access restrictions or embargoes based on privacy, security or other policies.
Examples: Contact Chief Investigator to negotiate access to the data
Embargoes until 1 year after publication of the research
Open Access allowed (see rights held in and over resource below)

item.label: Access Rights Type
item.name: accessRightsType
item.tooltip:
Open - Data is publicly accessible online
Conditional - Data is publicly accessible to certain conditions. For example: · a fee applies · the data is only accessible at a specific physical location
Restricted - Data access is limited. For example: · following an embargo period · to a particular group of users · where formal permission is granted

Open - Data is publicly accessible online Conditional - Data is publicly accessible subject to certain conditions. For example a fee applies or the data is only accessible at a specific physical location Restricted - Data access is limited. For example following an embargo period, it is limited to a particular group of users, where formal permission is granted

item.label: Rights held in and over the data
item.name: rightsStatement
item.tooltip:
Include information on copyright, licences and other intellectual property rights.
Examples: This dataset is made available under the Public Domain Dedication and Licence v1.0. Full text can be found at http://www.opendatacommons.org/licences/pddl/1.0/
Creative Commons Licence (CC BY or CC BY-SA or CC BY-ND or CC BY-NC or CC BY-NC-SA or CC BY-NC-ND) is assigned to this data. Details of the licence can be found at http://creativecommons.org.au/licences.
The (name) licence that controls this data is available at (URL)

item.label: Licence Type
item.name: licenceType
item.tooltip:
Further information on the licence types can be found at http://www.ausgoal.gov.au/the-ausgoal-licence-suite
Attribution - This licence lets others distribute, remix, tweak, and build upon your work, even commercially, as long as they credit you for the original creation. This is the most accomodating of licences offered. Recommended for maximum dissemination and use of licenced materials. Attribution-shareAlike - This licence lets others remix, tweak and build upon your work even for commercial purposes, as long as they credit you and licence their new creations under identical terms. This licence is often compared to 'copyleft' free and open source software licences. All new works based on yours will carry the same licence, so any derivatives will also allow commercial use. This is the licence used by Wikipedia, and is recommended for materials that would benefit from incorporating content from Wikipedia and similarly licenced projects. Attribution-NoDerivatives - This licence allows for redistribution, commercial and non-commercial, as long as it is passed along unchanged and in whole, with credit to you. Attribution-NonCommercial - This licence lets other remix, tweak and build upon your work non-commercially, and although their new works must also acknowledge you and be non-commercial, they don't have to licence their derivative works on the same terms. Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike - This licence lets others remix, tweak, and build upon your work non-commercially, as long as they credit you and licence their new creations under the identical terms. Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivatives - This licence is the most restrictive of AusGoal's six main licences, only allowing others to download your works and share them with others as long as they credit you, but they can't change them in any way or use them commercially. General Public Licence - The GNU General Public Licence is a free, copyleft licence for software and other kinds of works. Further information can be found at http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html AusGoal Restrictive Licence - This licence has been developed specifically for mateiral that may contain personal or other confidential information. It may also be used for other reasons, including material to be licenced under some form of limiting or restrictive condiation (e.g. a time limit on use, or payment arrangements others than an initial once-only fee).

option.label: Unknown/Other - Unknown licence or record provider defined licence

item.label: Licence
item.name: licence
item.tooltip: Licence Information

item.label: Data Location
item.name: dataLocation
item.tooltip:
Include where the data is located
Example: This data is located at (URL or physical location)

item.label: Embargo Date
item.name: embargoDate
item.tooltip: If this collection is under embargo, please provide the embargo lift date Example: 2020-01-01

item.label: Retention Period
item.name: dataRetention
item.tooltip:
Include the period of time that the data must be retained. This must be in line with institutional/funding body or legistlative retention
Examples: 7 years
Until 31st December 2016
Indefinately

item.label: Disposal Date
item.name: disposalDate
item.tooltip: The identified disposal date for this data is (date)

item.label: Extent or Quantity
item.name: dataExtent
item.tooltip: Enter the number of files that comprise the research dataset/collection

item.label: Data Size
item.name: dataSize
item.tooltip: Record the file size of the data in KB, MB, GB, TB, etc. If you are unsure, please consult your IT support person.

item.label: Data Management Plan
item.name: dataMgmtPlan
item.tooltip: Indicate if there is a data management plan for this data. Information on data management plans is found at http://libguides.anu.edu.au/datamanagement/
